data.title: Better directory copy logic, present error message instead of crashing if can't copy project template
App crash on Create New project or Open Existing project (Mac OSX)
data.body:
1. Open app (on a Mac running OSX El Capitan 10.11.3)
2. Select "Create New"
3. Add a project name (selected Typescript for lang)
4. Press "Create"
5. Selected 2d module
6. Loads for a second
7. App crash with this message:

```
ui/frames/ProjectFrame - cannot read property 'path' of undefined - Line: 421
```

Same error occurs when I try to open the .atomic project file created from the previous steps.

data.body: Just like in the new project dialog, there should be a dropdown for language type on the new script / new component and templates for Javascript and Typescript should be initially provided.

data.title: Reducing CMake configure time for OSX.
data.body: This is a partial for #625 for OSX only. It doesn't yet address Linux and Windows. I'll have to check Android as well, but I think that it does some try_compile calls, which could be removed.

data.title: On OSX "AtomicEditor Helper" needs a different target name.
data.body:
While working on #625, I found that "AtomicEditor Helper" has a space in it, and that causes newer versions of CMake to give a warning. The target name should have no special characters because it's a CMake symbol (variable name). The output file name can still be "AtomicEditor Helper" with something like:

```
set_target_properties(${CEF_HELPER_TARGET} PROPERTIES MACOSX_BUNDLE_BUNDLE_NAME “AtomicEditor Helper”)
```

Right now, "CEF_HELPER_TARGET" is used in a few other places as the bundle name, but this var should probably be split into "CEF_HELPER_BUNDLE_NAME" and "CEF_HELPER_TARGET". Otherwise, we get this:

```
$ cmake -G "Xcode" ../AtomicGameEngine
-- The C compiler identification is AppleClang 7.0.2.7000181
-- The CXX compiler identification is AppleClang 7.0.2.7000181
-- Check for working C compiler using: Xcode
-- Check for working C compiler using: Xcode -- works
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info - failed
-- Detecting C compile features
-- Detecting C compile features - done
-- Check for working CXX compiler using: Xcode
-- Check for working CXX compiler using: Xcode -- works
-- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info
-- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info - failed
-- Detecting CXX compile features
-- Detecting CXX compile features - done
-- curl version=[7.40.0]
-- Enabled features: SSL IPv6 unix-sockets libz
-- Enabled protocols: HTTP HTTPS
CMake Warning (dev) at Source/AtomicEditor/CMakeLists.txt:80 (add_executable):
  Policy CMP0037 is not set: Target names should not be reserved and should
  match a validity pattern.  Run "cmake --help-policy CMP0037" for policy
  details.  Use the cmake_policy command to set the policy and suppress this
  warning.

  The target name "AtomicEditor Helper" is reserved or not valid for certain
  CMake features, such as generator expressions, and may result in undefined
  behavior.
This warning is for project developers.  Use -Wno-dev to suppress it.

-- Configuring done
-- Generating done
```

data.title: Multiple selection causes the engine to freeze
data.body:
The more assets we select the more time it take for the assets to get selected (using hold + crtl select), when we have a lot of assets selected the engine will freeze. (I started to get heavy freeze around Patch_15

When we deselect a lot of assets the engine will also freeze.

If we select a lot of assets at the same time (Shift + select) the engine freeze.

I try the selection in the ToonTown selecting the Environment asset from Bush1 to Tree 2 including all the patch assets.

data.title: BUG - Hierarchy
data.body: We can no longer move/reorder object in the hierarchy

data.title: New code editor: selecting Save on Unsaved Modification Dialog does not save changes
Fixing code editor saves
Forward/back slash register as separate projects in the Recent Projects list
data.body:
Steps to replicate:
- Create a new project based on an example
- Close project
- The project shows up in the Recent Projects list with forward slashes
- Reopen this project using the Open Project button
- Close project
- A second entry is made for this project with back slashes

data.title: Code sign Windows binaries as a recognized app to prevent SmartScreen Filter message
Fix issue when drag/drop on same widget (fixes hierarchy node drag/drop), add pixel tolerance on initializing drag/drop operation
Editor/Player does not purge textures and potentially other runtime assets used by a scene when the scene is closed
data.body:
When I start Atomic, a process for Atomic start and it uses around 36k memory

If I play the game without opening a map/scene (just press the button play), another process for Atomic will start and it uses around 1.2Gk memory (I don't get lags while moving in the level). When I close the window that is playing the game this process end and the first Atomic process stay at 36k memory

If I open a map/scene, the first process rise to 1.2Gk since it load the map, but when I close the map the process does not go back to 36k memory it stays at 1.2Gk. When I play the game (with the map/scene close in the background) I have both Atomic process at 1.2 Gk memory which makes the game lag a lot, even so I still have 8Gm of free Ram.

data.title: Enable Chrome dev tools for WebView
data.body: Chromium comes with tooling for inspecting pages and debugging, look into enabling the tooling with the Atomic WebView (a top level window would be good, though will require API additions)

data.title: Investigate TypeScript API doc generation with TypeDoc
data.body:
Once initial TS API doc generation is hooked up, can integrate with build so available in Atomic Editor binary distro.  The Atomic API is large enough this should be a "multi-page" project, if TypeDoc supports it.  If not, will probably need an alternative.

The minimal theme seems nice: http://typedoc.io/themes/minimal
